jparsec.astrophysics.photometry

Class Photometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astrophysics.photometry.Photometry

  • public class Photometry
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to perform photometric calculations.

    2MASS information based on M. Cohen et al, "Spectral Irradiance Calibration in the Infrared. XIV. The Absolute Calibration of 2MASS", AJ 126, 1090 (2003).

    Johnson and Morgan based on Johnson, H. L., ApJ 141, 923 (1953).

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Photometry.FILTER
      The set of filters.

    • Method Detail

      • getFluxFromMagnitude

        public static MeasureElement getFluxFromMagnitude(double mag,
                                  double dmag,
                                  PhotometricBandElement band)
        Obtains the flux from a photometric measurement. If the flux is given in Jy, not in magnitudes, then the flux in Jy will be returned, but only if the corresponding field PhotometricBandElement.fluxGivenAsMagnitude is set to false.
        Parameters:
        mag - Absolute magnitude.
        dmag - Magnitude error.
        band - Data for the photometric band.
        Returns:
        Flux in Jy with its error.

      • getMagnitudeFromFlux

        public static MeasureElement getMagnitudeFromFlux(double flux,
                                  double dflux,
                                  PhotometricBandElement band)
        Obtains the flux from a photometric measurement. If the flux is given in Jy, not in magnitudes, then the flux in Jy will be returned, but only if the corresponding field PhotometricBandElement.fluxGivenAsMagnitude is set to false.
        Parameters:
        flux - Flux in Jy.
        dflux - Flux error.
        band - Data for the photometric band.
        Returns:
        Magnitude and magnitude error.

      • getApproximateJohnsonBVFromTycho

        public static double[] getApproximateJohnsonBVFromTycho(double Bt,
                                        double Vt,
                                        boolean ESA_method)
                                                 throws JPARSECException
        Obtains approximate B and V magnitudes from Tycho BT and VT magnitudes.

        Parameters:
        Bt - Tycho-2 BT magnitude.
        Vt - Tycho-2 VT magnitude.
        ESA_method - Method to apply, ESA official one (true) or the one developed by M. Kidger and F. Martin-Luis (false). The one by Kidger seems to be better. For explanations and request see http://homepage.ntlworld.com/roger.dymock/Tycho Photometry.htm.
        Returns:
        B and V magnitudes.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
        See Also:
        bvTychoTobvJohnson(double) method at Colors class for a possibly better algorithm.

      • getJohnsonVRFromCousins

        public static double getJohnsonVRFromCousins(double vr)
        Obtains V-R color in Johnson system from Cousins system. Reference: Fernie, J. D., 1983PASP...95..782F.
        Parameters:
        vr - V-R color in Cousins.
        Returns:
        V-R in Johnson.

      • getJohnsonVIFromCousins

        public static double getJohnsonVIFromCousins(double vi)
        Obtains V-I color in Johnson system from Cousins system. Reference: Fernie, J. D., 1983PASP...95..782F.
        Parameters:
        vi - V-I color in Cousins.
        Returns:
        V-I in Johnson.

      • getJohnsonRIFromCousins

        public static double getJohnsonRIFromCousins(double ri)
        Obtains R-I color in Johnson system from Cousins system. Reference: Fernie, J. D., 1983PASP...95..782F.
        Parameters:
        ri - R-I color in Cousins.
        Returns:
        R-I in Johnson.

      • getFilterWavelengths

        public static double[] getFilterWavelengths(Photometry.FILTER filterID)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns the filter set of wavelengths in microns.
        Parameters:
        filterID - The filter ID constant.
        Returns:
        The set of wavelengths.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the filter does not exist.

      • getFilterTransmitancy

        public static double[] getFilterTransmitancy(Photometry.FILTER filterID)
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Returns the filter set of transmitancies, each of them for the corresponding filter wavelength. The values are normalized to unity.

        The transmitancies are based on Johnson, ApJ 141, 923 (1965), and Cohen et al, AJ 126, 1090 (2003).

        Parameters:
        filterID - The filter ID constant.
        Returns:
        The set of transmitancies.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the filter does not exist.

      • getFilterSpectrum

        public static Spectrum getFilterSpectrum(Photometry.FILTER filterID,
                         int np)
                                  throws JPARSECException
        Returns the transmitancy spectrum of a given filter.
        Parameters:
        filterID - The filter.
        np - The number of points in the output spectrum.
        Returns:
        The spectrum.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the filter does not exist.

      • getStarFlux

        public static double getStarFlux(double Tef,
                 Photometry.FILTER filterID)
                          throws JPARSECException
        Returns the flux of a star for a given effective temperature and integrated over a given filter.
        Parameters:
        Tef - The effective temperature of the star in K.
        filterID - The filter ID constant.
        Returns:
        The flux, in units of Jy micron / sr.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the filter does not exist.

      • getStarFluxUsingKuruczModels

        public static double getStarFluxUsingKuruczModels(double m,
                                  double r,
                                  double Tef,
                                  Photometry.FILTER filterID)
                                           throws JPARSECException
        Returns the flux of a Kurucz star for a given effective temperature and integrated over a given filter.
        Parameters:
        m - Star mass in solar units.
        r - Star radius in solar units.
        Tef - The effective temperature of the star in K.
        filterID - The filter ID constant.
        Returns:
        The flux, in units of Jy micron / sr.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the filter does not exist.

      • getBlackBodyColorIndex

        public static double getBlackBodyColorIndex(double Tef,
                            Photometry.FILTER filterID1,
                            Photometry.FILTER filterID2,
                            boolean vega)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Deprecated. This method is not accurate, use getColorIndexUsingKuruczModels(double, double, double, FILTER, FILTER, boolean) instead.
        Returns the color index of a star (considered as a black body) between two filters.
        Parameters:
        Tef - Effective temperature.
        filterID1 - The first filter.
        filterID2 - The second filter.
        vega - True to use Vega as reference for 0 magnitude, false for a synthetic star.
        Returns:
        The approximate color index M (filter1) - M (filter2).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the filters are invalid.

      • getColorIndexUsingKuruczModels

        public static double getColorIndexUsingKuruczModels(double m,
                                    double r,
                                    double Tef,
                                    Photometry.FILTER filterID1,
                                    Photometry.FILTER filterID2,
                                    boolean vega)
                                             throws JPARSECException
        Returns the color index between two filters using Kurucz models.

        Calculations can be performed using Vega as reference.

        Parameters:
        m - Star mass in solar units.
        r - Star radius in solar units.
        Tef - Effective temperature.
        filterID1 - The first filter.
        filterID2 - The second filter.
        vega - True to use Vega as reference for 0 magnitude, false for a synthetic star.
        Returns:
        The approximate color index M (filter1) - M (filter2).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the filters are invalid.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
